cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 220 miles SE of Galveston, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: expected to drift west-northwest today, then slowly northwest to north toward the upper Texas coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: mid/upper Texas coast, likely between Port O’Connor and Freeport, TX

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning; Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: Port Aransas TX to High Island TX (Hurricane Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Port Aransas TX to Morgan City LA (Tropical Storm Warning); Port Aransas TX to Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge LA including Galveston Bay (Storm Surge Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and upper Texas coast and southwestern Louisiana coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–60 mph) with gusts over 60 mph possible at Galveston
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation above ground possible in and around Galveston Bay
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–12 inches with isolated totals up to 20 inches possible, leading to flash and urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; minor river flooding possible
